utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, so did everything go okay with the annulment?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, no problems. It’s all taken care of.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, thank you. Hey, do you guys wanna go see a movie?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh yeah, why not?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, umm, I’m gonna get my sweater.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay. You uh, you wanna hear something weird?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Always.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I didn’t get the annulment.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We’re still married! Don’t tell Rachel. See you later.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, do you have any gum?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh? Yeah! Sure!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait! Wait! Hi! Listen, Ross can I just talk to you for just a second?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh but Phoebe, we’re gonna be late for the movie.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, there’s a cab! Taxi!! Good timing, my God, huh? Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, we’re, we’re actually just gonna walk ‘cause it’s right up there at the Angelica.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, the Angelica!! Go! Go! You didn’t get the annulment?!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ross?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I tried! But when I got to my lawyer’s office all I could hear was, "Three divorces. Three divorces!" Look, I just don’t want my tombstone to read, Ross Gellar, Three Divorces.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Don’t be worried about that! Your tombstone can say whatever you want it to say! It could say, Ross Geller, Good at Marriage! Y’know? Mine’s gonna say Phoebe Buffay, Buried Alive.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, all I know is I-I can’t have another failed marriage!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So okay what? You’re gonna be married to a girl who doesn’t even know about it?!—Op, woman! Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, okay so, I don’t have it all worked out quite yet. Just don’t say anything to Rachel, please?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Rachel is one of my closest friends. Although, being the only one who knows anything about this does makes me feel special. Okay!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, stop-stop! Phoebe?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey Rach!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What was that?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Sorry, mix up. Hey, how was the movie?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I haven’t seen it yet!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well then you’d better hurry! The Angelica! Go! Go!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Noooooooo!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know when we move in together, can I get a gumball machine?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Of course! Joey wouldn’t let you have one?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No. When it comes to sweets, he’s surprisingly strict.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, have you figured out a way to tell him you’re moving out?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, no, I keep trying, y’know? I can get out, "Joey, I have too…" but then I lose my nerve and I always finish with, "…go to the bathroom." He may think I’m sick.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y’know, I really have to tell Rachel, but I… We just have to get it over with! Y’know, the next time we see them we’re just gonna tell them. Okay? That’s it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, so that’s this is gonna work now? You’re just gonna order me around all the time?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Pretty much.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Monica!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey man, you feeling any better?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, we have something to tell you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh my God! You’re pregnant!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No-o-o! No? No-o-o! Look Joey, here’s the thing, Monica and I have decided to live together, here. So, I’m gonna be moving out man.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow! Well, uh… Hey! I’m really happy for you guys! Congratulations! See you later.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait! Joey! Joey! Are you okay?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, I gotta go! I got an acting job. Like you’d believe that. This sucks!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, I-I’m just gonna be right across the hall and I promise you, the minute Monica and I break up I’m moving right back in with you!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay! Look-look-look, uh, if you’re gonna be moving in with him I feel it’s my responsibility to tell you the truth about him! Okay? He’s a terrible roommate! Terrible! He uh, forgets to umm… Oh-oh he always, he always umm—Oh, who am I kidding! He’s the best roommate ever!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey Pheebs!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, have you seen Rachel?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, why?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I have some pretty exciting news!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You’re pregnant!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No! Chandler and I are moving in together!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh! That’s good! Wow! But now if you were pregnant, what would you name it? Hint: Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! Hi!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well umm, Chandler and I are moving in together.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh my God. Ohh, my little sister and my best friend…shaking up. Oh, that’s great. That’s great.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Guys, I’m happy too.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, come here!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! Big day huh? People moving in, people getting annulled…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I gotta go find Rachel but umm, if you guys see her could you please try to give her some really bad news so that mine doesn’t seem so bad?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hmm, something bad to tell Rachel… Bad news for Rachel, what could that be?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Could ya just, could ya just lay off, please? All right? My life is an embarrassment! I should go live under somebody’s stairs!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ross, it’s not that big a deal! So you’ll been divorced three times, you’ll still have a life, you’ll go on dates…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No! No, I won’t! I’ll be at the bottom of the dating barrel now. The only guys below me will be Four Divorce Guy uh, Murderer Guy, and-and, Geologists.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ross, you’re being ridiculous! Okay? You are cute and smart and sweet and that is much more important than three stupid divorces!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh yeah? Have you ever dated anyone who has been divorced three times?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Y’know that’s really fair. Y’know? Most guys who have been divorced three times are like 60. Ross, nobody cares about this except you! This-this embarrassment thing is all in your head! Here, I’ll show you! Come here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?! Why?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi! Hi! Listen, my friend Ross is about to be divorced for the third time, but wouldn’t you date him?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And if you wait right here, I’ll go get Ross.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ugh, I thought you were Rachel!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What gave me away?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I just tell her, I have to get it over with. I told Ross and Phoebe and she’s the only one left!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, so that’s it, everybody knows! It’s official, we’re moving in together. No turning back. Are ya scared? Are ya?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wow that was my scariest voice! You’re very brave.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ugh, the worse day! Y’know, you think you’re making progress at work and then your boss calls you Raquel.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey listen, for the first four years of my work everybody called me Sha-la-lap. Seriously.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I believe you. So, it was right in the middle of a staff meeting so of course no one else wants to correct her so everyone else is calling me Raquel! By the end of the day, the mailroom guys were calling me Rocky!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I-I still think you’re very-very nice and very pretty…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All yours babe.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Have a seat. Okay, listen umm, Chandler and I are going to live together, here.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! That’s so great! I’m so happy for you guys!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And that was so sweet of you to ask! Oh my God, the three of us are gonna have such a good time living together!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes, we are.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And Chandler, you’re gonna have to watch those long showers you take in the morning because you know Raquel can’t be late.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Rach…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, he’s gonna work on that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh! This is so exciting! Oh God… Come and knock on my door…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We’ll be waiting for you…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: …once you know the stories, it’s not that bad. First marriage, wife’s hidden sexuality, not my fault. Second marriage, said the wrong name at the altar, a little my fault. Third marriage, well they really shouldn’t allow you to get married when you’re that drunk and have writing all over your face, Nevada’s fault.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, so what do you think ladies? Who wouldn’t be interested? Who wouldn’t want to date him?

utterance.speaker: Stephanie
utterance.content: Well the divorces don’t bother me, I’d date him. But, not while he’s still married.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, what about you? Wouldn’t you want a date?

utterance.speaker: Karin
utterance.content: Actually, I’m dating at all anymore. See, I figured out that I was only dating guys that were like y’know bad for me, so until I work that out…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Whatever! What about you Meg?

utterance.speaker: Meg
utterance.content: Well, I don’t care about the divorces either, but I wouldn’t date him. It’s just that he’s obviously still in love with this Rachel girl.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: She said, "He’s obviously still in love with this Rachel girl."

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This is crazy! I mean, yes-yes Rachel is my good friend and I-I have loved her in the past, but now, she is just my wife! Phoebe, will you-will you help me out here?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I thought you loved her when you-when you married her.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We were drunk! I would’ve married uh, Joey with that amount of alcohol!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey! You could do a lot worse than Joey Tribbiani!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, I’m sorry, but you guys are wrong. I just don’t want to be divorced three times.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes, and now he’s using this three divorces reason because he wants to stay married to her because he loves her. I must say, "Well done!" Bravo Meg.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay! Fine! Fine! If-if this is what you think, forget about the whole three divorce thing! Okay, I-I’ll go to my lawyer’s office right now and get this marriage annulled! Okay?! Because she means nothing to me! Noth——Nothing!!

utterance.speaker: Meg
utterance.content: Okay now I wouldn’t date you because you seem a little creepy.

utterance.speaker: Karin
utterance.content: I am so attracted to him right now.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, when are we gonna tell Rachel what is actually gonna happen?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Soon! I-I just couldn’t before. You saw how upset Joey got! I couldn’t do that to her, she’s my best friend!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, Joey’s my best friend.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m not your best friend?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You just said… Of course you’re my best friend. Would you please tell Rachel though?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, all right, at least I’m prepared.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. Oh yes.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey-hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: These aren’t for you! Are you upset?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I am now!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey roomie!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, bye!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Rach, there’s something uh, important I have to tell you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Are you pregnant?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No! But, I’m throwing this shirt away! I think there was a little misunderstanding before.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Um-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Umm, when I said that uh, that Chandler and I wanted to umm, live together we meant alone together.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! Oh, that’s funny, I can’t believe I did that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh no sweetie, no! This is my fault, I wasn’t clear! I’m really sorry. And listen, you take as much time as you need to move out okay? There’s absolutely no rush.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. Don’t you want a cookie?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Sure? Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Maybe, do you need a tissue?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Monica, where did you get these?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I made them!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh, good God, they’re so yummy!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: God, it’s gonna so weird like when I come home and you’re not here. Y’know? No more Joey and Chan’s. No more J and C’s. "You wanna go over to Joey and Chandler’s?" "Can’t, its not there."

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, I’m just gonna be across the hall, we can still do all the same stuff.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah but we won’t be able to like get up in the middle of the night and have those long talks about our feelings and the future.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Not once did we do that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So I, I told Rachel it was just gonna be the two of us.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah? Well, how’d she take it?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really well. Yeah. Surprisingly well. Yeah, she didn’t cry. She wasn’t angry or sad.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And you’re upset because you didn’t make your best friend cry?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I mean, all I’m asking for is just a little emotion! Is that too much to ask after six years?! I mean what? Are-are-are Rachel and I not as close as you guys?! I mean do we not have as much fun?! Don’t I deserve a few tears?!! I mean we-we told Joey, he cried his eyes out!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! I did not cry my eyes out!! Come on! It’s like the end of an era! No more J-man and Channie’s!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, I gotta ask, who calls us that?!

utterance.speaker: Russell
utterance.content: You got married again.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Russell
utterance.content: So that’s your second marriage in two years.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes, second in two years. Third overall.

utterance.speaker: Russell
utterance.content: Ross, I have been a divorce attorney for 23 years and never had I so much business from one client. Why don’t you tell me what happened.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Basically, Rachel and I were in Vegas and we got drunk…

utterance.speaker: Russell
utterance.content: I’m sorry, is this the same Rachel who’s name you said at the altar in the second marriage?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes-yes-yes! But, I-I do not love her.

utterance.speaker: Russell
utterance.content: Oh, that’s better then.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This was just a drunken mistake and I need to get it annulled.

utterance.speaker: Russell
utterance.content: I see. Have you considered therapy?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I think just the annulment for today.

utterance.speaker: Russell
utterance.content: There are a couple of forms to fill out.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Easy.

utterance.speaker: Russell
utterance.content: And we’ll need to have witnesses who can testify that you were not of uh, sound mind.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No problem.

utterance.speaker: Russell
utterance.content: And we’ll need you and Rachel to testify before a judge.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ooh! There’s no way to do this without her? ‘Cause I kinda all ready told her uh, it was, it was already taken care of.

utterance.speaker: Russell
utterance.content: Of course you did. Look Ross, you can’t get an annulment unless you and Rachel are both there.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh-ha, what about someone who looks like Rachel? I will think about the therapy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey. So um, I was thinking that maybe we should start dividing up our stuff.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y’know, no point in dragging it out. Dragging out the long process of you moving out and us not living together anymore.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey Rach, what about this? Huh? Who-who gets this? See, I don’t know if I want it because it might be y’know, too many memories!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What the hell is that?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don’t know. Hey, Rachel, you want the big plate? I want you to have the big plate.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! Mon, thanks! I love this plate!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Something to remember me by!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Mon, honey you’re not dying. I’m just moving out. Y’know, I mean we’re gonna see each other all the time.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: But still, it’s a big change. The end of an era, you might say!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Are you okay? You’re not blinking.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m fine! I just, I’m thinking how much it’s an end of era.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, all right. But y’know I gotta say, I don’t, I don’t think six years counts as an era.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: An era is defined as a significant period of time. Now, it was significant to me, maybe it wasn’t significant to you!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What is the matter with you?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What is the matter with you?!! Why aren’t you more upset?! Aren’t you gonna be sad that we’re not gonna be living together anymore?! I mean aren’t you gonna miss me at all?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, fine, but don’t get mad at me. It’s-it’s just a little hard to believe.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What’s hard to believe?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well y’know, it’s you guys. You-you do this kind of stuff! Y’know? I mean, you-you were gonna get married in Vegas and then you backed out! I guess I’m not upset because I don’t see you guys going through with it. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Rachel, it’s going to happen. Chandler is gonna move in here.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But I…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No-no, wait! Just let me finish, okay? This isn’t something that we just, we just impulsively decided in-in Vegas, this is something we both really want. And it is going to happen.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It is? Really?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, sweetie.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I mean we’re not, we’re not gonna live together anymore?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? Oh my God! I’m gonna miss you so much!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m gonna miss you!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I mean it’s the end of an era!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, bye!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh no.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So? Did you get the annulment?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I couldn’t.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I knew it! Because you love Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s not that. Okay? Annulments are more complicated than I…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, complicated ‘cause of the love.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I… I do, I do not love Rachel. I’m gonna tell her right now about the whole thing so we can get this marriage annulled as fast as possible. Okay? Would I do that if I loved her?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’ve never been more convinced of your love for her.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I do not have feelings for Rachel! Okay?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ohh, what’s wrong?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Monica and Chandler are really moving in here and I have to move out and everything is changing.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh my—Come here! Come here! It’s okay. Everything’s gonna be okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So, Ross and Rachel got married, Monica and Chandler almost got married, do you think you and I should hook up?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh we do, but not just yet.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Really?! Well, when?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay umm, well, first Chandler and Monica will get married and be filthy rich by the way. Yeah. But it won’t work out.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know. Then, I’m gonna marry Chandler for the money and you’ll marry Rachel and have the beautiful kids.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Great!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But then we ditch those two and that’s when we get married. We’ll have Chandler’s money and Rachel’s kids and getting custody will be easy because of Rachel’s drinking problem.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh-oh, what about Ross?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don’t want to go into the whole thing, but umm, we have words and I kill him.
